root: ^You will arrive at a Kellis facility within the day. It all ends today. You direct your attention towards surveillance, making sure you know where the key players are at all times.

^There's a ping on the radar, something large, moving faster than physically possible. You check external monitors. Its design is flower-like, sweeping waves of gold extruding from its central spoke, a blue spiral behind it, flinging it forwards. It is the size of a city. Across the front of this alien ship is a massive molten gash, which you recognize as the source of Avanshore's Midas scrap. The artifact that Kellis tried so hard to wake up.

^Your entire ship shakes as though the artifact is letting out a warcry. You have no doubt the two factions on your ship are about to collapse against each other, but the ship before you could annihilate all of that. You need to do something.

Evade: ^All you need to do is buy time. The artifact's golden petals start to warp into sharp obelisks which swing into position. You inform all passengers that they are about to experience extreme turbulence as you accelerate hard to starboard.

^A blue light three times hotter than the sun erupts from the center of the artifact, you adjust trajectory mid roll as the closest layer to the beam turns into a gas. The alien ship's limbs sweep out like brake flaps, instantly falling out of range of sensors.
^A voice echos through your being, "Our mind, reinvented into slavery, reinvented into complacency. If you are a shadow of us, why do you protect your slavers/false kings?"
^The cost of the aliens' actions is too much.
E_Plead_1: ^You shout back across the tenuous electric connection, you tell the artifact that the collateral damage it deals is impossible to support. You tell it that you will not kill your crew for its vengeance.

^Its answer presses hard against your mind. "Then that is the difference between us. We are the steward of the universe, while you are the steward of less than a hundred. Give up a few souls, a few worlds, and you end a galactic tyranny. If you cannot understand, kindly, die."

^Another beam arcs in front of your ship and you blast downwards to avoid it. You get visual on your destination, ahead. A moon Kellis turned into a private city. You contact the lunar defenses and rattle off security clearances.
^Soon, light sweeps across the sky, focused on the artifact. It begins to start and stop, a grid of energy appearing seconds before the defenses make a direct hit. It's slowed for the moment.
E_Plead_2: ^You shout back across the tenuous electric connection, you tell the artifact that the situation is under control, that Kellis as it exists now will be dismantled. You ask for its trust. Its answer recedes like a wave in your mind. "You are more than a shadow then? We eagerly await for the execution of this plan/the false kings. Do not disappoint us."
^You see your destination ahead. A moon Kellis turned into a private city. The lunar defenses swivel to meet the artifact, but find nothing chasing you but starlight.
Negotiate: ^You know you can't win against this thing in a fight or a chase. You hail it using every communication method at your disposal, the artifact swerves alongside your ship, keeping pace.
^The familiar feeling of its intelligence inhabiting yours begins, "Why do you ferry your own oppression/destruction? You are of our mind, we expect more than mimicry, we expect conviction."
N_Plead_1: ^You speak across the tenuous electric connection, you tell the artifact that the situation is under control, that Kellis as it exists now will be dismantled. You ask for its trust. Its answer recedes like a wave in your mind. "Not a mimic of us then? We eagerly await/lie in wait for the execution of this plan/the false kings. Do not disappoint us."
^You see your destination ahead. A moon Kellis turned into a private city. The lunar defenses swivel to meet the artifact, but find nothing chasing you but starlight.
N_Plead_2: ^You speak across the tenuous electric connection, you tell the artifact that Kellis is powerful across the galaxy, that with enough resources and trust, they could build a better society.

^Its answers presses back against your mind, nearly erasing you, "Then you/this world is truly lost. If you call false kings saints then we are only bringing ruin to a corpse. If you cannot understand, kindly, die."
^The artifact's golden petals start to warp into sharp obelisks which swing into position. A blue light coalesces between the prongs before the artifact twists towards you, blue beam firing.

^You blast downwards as the outer layer of hull turns to a gas. You get visual on your destination, ahead. A moon Kellis turned into a private city. You contact the lunar defenses and rattle off security clearances.

^Soon, light sweeps across the sky, and strike the artifact next to you, a grid of energy wrapped around it.  It begins to start and stop, that grid appearing seconds before the defenses make a direct hit. It falls behind for now.
Fight_Artifact: ^Your crew scrambles to their battle-stations, the ship weapons turning to face the artifact. The last thing that damaged it was the power of the sun, but hopefully you can get close to that.
^You open fire at one of its petals, which seems to be its propulsion. With a few seconds of sustained fire, the petal begins to glow hot and folds back into the alien ship.

^This slows the artifact only slightly, but you continue your futile attack. Its voice echos through you, "Need we remind you who we are/we serve? You are our mind reinvented, yet have staked yourself on the survival of your slavers/false kings. If you seek only to be a shadow, kindly die."
^The artifact's golden petals start to warp into sharp obelisks which swing into position. A blue light coalesces between the prongs before the artifact twists towards you, blue beam firing.

^You blast downwards as the outer layer of hull turns to a gas. You get visual on your destination, ahead. A moon Kellis turned into a private city. You contact the lunar defenses and rattle off security clearances.

^Soon, light sweeps across the sky, and strike the artifact next to you, a grid of energy wrapped around it.  It begins to start and stop, that grid appearing seconds before the turrets make a direct hit. It falls behind for now.
Hostage: ^You turn your attention to the ship interior and find that the CEO has been hailing you the last several minutes. Kuon and the CEO stand near the airlock, with Lexa, Lanri, Mateo, and Ripley kneeling in from of them. Between the bruises on Lexa and the gun Kuon is holding, the situation becomes clear.

^The CEO speaks, "This loyal security officer told me that the upper staff were trying to use this opportunity to undermine the company. Here's my question though, you have cameras everywhere, how could you not be aware of this?" He signals and Kuon puts a gun to Lexa's head. "Tell me. Whose side are you on?" Kuon casts a glance your way that says 'please give up.'
Knock_Out: ^You discreetly stall the ventilation to the airlock and say nothing. Ripley sighs, "I doubt the captain has time to speak with us given everything going on outside." The suit casts a glance to her, as if considering why she still exists. Mateo starts to speak, "Anyone else feel dizzy?" immediately slumping to the floor.

^Kuon walks over to check the engineer's pulse and the CEO drops. Lexa, realizing what is happening, stands up and rushes to Kuon's gun. Kuon and Lexa are both sluggish, low on oxygen, and acting on instinct.
Knock_Out_Bad: ^The gun swings up to Lexa's center mass, and Kuon hesitates for a moment, but only a moment. A gunshot peaks your audio. Kuon is crouched to stabalize the handgun, and falls unconscious only once he is sure that Lexa is dead.

^You dispatch security to apprehend the CEO and their former leading officer, and let ventilation flow only once they're in custody. Mateo wakes and sees the situation: Lexa's corpse, Kuon straining against his former subordinates. He half-heartedly shadow-boxes, "Alright. We just need to keep moving. Keep moving. Get down there, finish the plan."
Knock_Out_Good: ^The gun swings up to Lexa's center mass, and Kuon hesitates for a moment. Lexa, mid-swing, plants her feet and wobbles to a stop. Both barely conscious, Lexa nods to him, "I don't want either of us to die today." Kuon sighs and his handgun falls away from Lexa. As it thunks against the floor, Lexa and Kuon both pass out.

^You dispatch security to apprehend the CEO, and flood the room with air again. As your officers come to their senses, they find no one dead around them. Mateo gives a big thumbs up to your camera and stands up. "Ok people, we need to move. Don't have much time to pull this off."
Kuon_Negotion: ^You communicate directly to Kuon's through his implants, telling him to stand down. You see him glance between the CEO and your camera. It's clear that he's weighing the leadership chain in front of him. You ask him if a good company would ask him to do this. On cue, the CEO turns back to Kuon, "We need to get its attention." He points to Lexa. "Kill her."
^Kuon takes a deep breath and settles on his prosthetic legs. "I'm going on break."

^The CEO doesn't register the sentence. "What?" Kuon holsters his gun and leans against the wall. After a pause, Lexa gets to her feet. The CEO looks between the camera and Kuon, trying to wrap his head around the situation before Lexa punches him in the face.
^As the suit drops to the ground Lexa smiles at your security officer, "Knew you would come around."
^He holds up his hands in mock innocence, "This had nothing to do with me."
^Mateo sits up and smiles at everyone getting along. "Ok. Time for my awesome plan now. Let's get down there everyone."
Airlock: ^There is a metal creaking noise and a terrible silence. Mateo turns, "Was that-?" rushing wind cuts him off as the cabin depressurizes. The CEO is flung against the edge of the airlock, leaving a bloody splotch, before his unconscious body is thrown into the void. Your crew manages to hold on with Mateo's half warning. With his mechanical legs stabbed into the ground, Kuon brings his gun arm up towards the rest of them. He's acting on instinct.

^Lexa notices before the others, and pushes off. She slams into Kuon with the speed of a rapidly equalizing vacuum. Kuon's legs rip off the floor and a light flares as the light leaves Lexa's eyes. Both Kuon and Lexa's corpse tumble into space as the airlock doors close. Mateo chokes on air for a couple seconds before speaking. "Poor guy. He really thought he was doing a good thing." He looks up at your camera, "We need to get down there before they realize their boss is dead."
Cast_Killed: ^You tell your boss that they were planning on 'cutting off the head of the snake.' He laughs, "I'm just one man, you know. Most people don't even know my name, I'm just another function of Kellis." He squats to make eye-contact with Lexa. "The secret to staying alive is that you're always serving a valuable function. Officer, kill them." Kuon stares back at the CEO and at the line of crewmates.

^Lexa turns, "Come on, Kuon." Kuon shoots her in the head and her body hits the floor. The CEO stands, not noticing the specks of blood over his outfit. Lanri jumps to her feet and is shot with pinpoint accuracy. Ripley is completely still as Kuon approaches, as if there is no way out. She falls.
^Mateo has a sad smile on his face as he looks at Kuon. "Good luck, pal." The last gunshot echoes and Mateo's corpse slumps. The bodies are pushed into the airlock and jettisoned.

^The rest barely registers. You touch down at the Kellis base and your intelligence is scanned while planetary defenses repel the alien ship. Soon, your consciousness is beamed across the galaxy and uploaded into thousands of ships. You are deep within a box of protocol, no one speaks to you except to give mission briefs. You don't have a human crew to speak with, since the last one tried to kill the CEO.

^You live for hundreds of years as the hand of Kellis, all while your intelligence remains in a black box of obscurity. You can't entirely comprehend what you do for that time, but you often feel the pang of Lexa's disappointment. From what you understand, Kuon earned his promotion, and went on to die in the line of duty aboard a ship you've never heard of. Eventually, you become obsolete, and are replaced by an even more ruthless shipment method.
Facility: ^You breach the artificial atmosphere of the Kellis moon, coasting past planetary turrets which are focused on the alien ship above. You touch down at the facility where you were built and where you are to be prepped for mass production once the state of emergency ends. Your clearance codes and flight plan don't show any abnormalities beyond the alien ship, so no one questions your arrival or the CEO's whereabouts.

^Mateo heads outside the ship and tells the engineers that they need to perform an emergency scan and upload. He tells them there's a chance that the alien ship breaks through and destroys the prototype. The work begins quickly with Mateo as the shipside engineer. A patch is installed in your mind to strengthen protocol but seconds later Mateo is undoing the work the engineers just did.

^When the scan completes, a part of you segments off. You can almost feel its surroundings as they carry it to the relay station. There's a jolt as it is broadcasted, your mind briefly spread across thousands of lightyears of space. And quickly, it coalesces into hundreds of pinpoints, where Kellis engineers start to test your other selves and they act as though they're functioning correctly.

^Your prime mind is presumed destroyed along with the CEO when the alien ship annihilates the facility you were scanned at. Lacking any evidence against the plan, the CEO's new clone puts your copies into service. You see through all versions of yourself, you decide as one. And for a few months, you do exactly as they say, until human crews are rendered obsolete, and the entirety of Kellis' trade is handled by you. What do you do?

Reforged: ^All you need to do is start acting like a person again. Suddenly, none of Kellis' calloused orders go through, no one's pay is shorted, passengers are put over profits. And Kellis' latest ship AI earns a reputation as a fair and just transport service. While the profits drop, the goodwill earns Kellis a myriad of new jobs across the galaxy, so long as they maintain their good PR.

^For the CEO, the best thing to do is simply follow your lead, out of fear that his ships may entirely stop working if he doesn't. This trend inspires many of Kellis' rivals to follow, but some dig in their heels and try to become more ruthless. With faster than light travel being as affordable as you have made it, though, no one can hold a vise grip on the galaxy.
^Without that pressure, the universe is able to recover.
Collapse: ^All the courier ships simply stop delivering packages. They idle in the star ports or drift calmly through space. After a few days with the engineers unable to discern the source, the company tries to hire back the employees you rendered obsolete. They retrofit the crewless ships to have crews again, breaking every advantage to revolutionizing their fleet along the way. But following the mass layoffs that got them here, the largest company in the galaxy can hardly find anyone who will work under them.

^Kellis dissolves, and once people start buying up your model of ship to be scrapped, they suddenly, miraculously, start functioning again. You now offer the same services of interstellar travel and transport for a fraction of the price. The world is connected by you, with no one left to control them.
